bugs.title: suricata.service file uses unknown options on EL7

bugzilla.short_desc: suricata.service file uses unknown options on EL7

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

Jul 31 09:05:29 localhost systemd[1]: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/suricata.service:17] Unknown lvalue 'MemoryDenyWriteExecute' in section 'Service'
Jul 31 09:05:29 localhost systemd[1]: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/suricata.service:18] Unknown lvalue 'LockPersonality' in section 'Service'
Jul 31 09:05:29 localhost systemd[1]: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/suricata.service:19] Unknown lvalue 'ProtectControlGroups' in section 'Service'
Jul 31 09:05:29 localhost systemd[1]: [/usr/lib/systemd/system/suricata.service:20] Unknown lvalue 'ProtectKernelModules' in section 'Service'

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
suricata-4.1.4-3.el7.x86_64
suricata-4.1.5-2.el7 was built to fix this issue. The security options are now only applied to Fedora builds.
FEDORA-2019-b2037db7d0 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 31. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-b2037db7d0
FEDORA-2019-0574d3bf77 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 30. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2019-0574d3bf77

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by sgrubb.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'waiting'.
This update has obsoleted [suricata-4.1.5-1.el7](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2019-d2396b82bb), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has been pushed to testing.

notes:
This is a bugfix release where some of the bugs fixed are security bugs. Please update.
